Headline: Turkish students found dead in Ukraine building
Description: Bodies of two women, aged 20 and 22, were found in their rented apartment in northeastern Kharkiv city, media report.

Headline: Putin says no talks with Ukraine about release of sailors
Description: Russia is resisting international calls to release three Ukrainian naval ships that its border patrols fired upon and seized in the strait near Russian-annexed Crimea last weekend.

Headline: Ukraine calls up reservists amid tensions with Russia
Description: Kremlin dismisses Ukrainian leader's statement that the country needs to beef up its defenses to counter the threat of a Russian invasion, as an "absurd" attempt to inflame tensions.

Headline: Ukraine's Orthodox bishops establish new church
Description: Ukrainian Orthodox leaders say they have approved the creation of a unified church independent of the Moscow Patriarchate and elected a leader to head the new church.

Headline: IMF approves $3.9B credit line for Ukraine, releases $1.4B immediately
Description: A $3.9 billion stand-by aid agreement for Ukraine has been approved by the IMF, ahead of a turbulent election period. The World Bank has also announced a $750 billion loan guarantee.

Headline: It's been five years since Russia annexed Crimea
Description: It is in everyone’s interest that Ukraine remains independent and sovereign and maintains the ability to choose its destiny without outside interference.

Headline: Kiev and West slam elections in separatist-ruled Ukraine cities
Description: US embassy in Kiev calls on residents of two self-proclaimed republics Donetsk and Lugansk to boycott "the elections which are not in line with either the Minsk agreements or Ukrainian law."

Headline: Ukraine separatists hold polls in defiance of West
Description: EU foreign policy chief Federica Mogherini says the bloc considered the polls in Donetsk and Lugansk to be "illegal and illegitimate and will not recognise them."

Headline: Ukraine separatists elect leaders in defiance of West
Description: Kremlin-backed separatists choose their new leaders despite Western calls on Moscow not to sabotage peace talks.

Headline: Orthodox independence in Ukraine: What's Next?
Description: The Ukraine Orthodox Church has a historic opportunity to gain independence from Moscow, whether it can grasp this opportunity is anyone's guess.

Headline: Will comedian’s election victory end Ukraine’s political divide?
Description: Renowned TV comic Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s very likely victory may transcend the country's deepest political schism which has long played into the Russian hands.

Headline: Can a comedian in Ukraine become a 'servant of the people'?
Description: Volodomyr Zelensky might be a comedian but the first round of voting has shown that his candidacy is no joke.

Headline: Rivals in Ukraine's presidential runoff debate at stadium
Description: Incumbent President Petro Poroshenko attacks candidate Volodymyr Zelenskiy's inexperience and claims he is dangerously pro-Russia and in turn the comic actor accuses his rival of being corrupt.

Headline: Comedian appears set to take presidency in Ukraine vote
Description: Dismayed by endemic corruption and a struggling economy, Ukrainian voters appear poised to strongly rebuke incumbent Petro Poroshenko and replace him with TV star Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

Headline: Five things to know about Ukraine
Description: Polls have opened and Ukrainians are voting in the second round of the country's presidential election. Here are five facts about a country at war wanting transformational change.

Headline: New Ukraine President Zelenskiy dissolves parliament
Description: Zelenskiy, a comedian with no prior political experience, won the presidency by a landslide last month but his new party has no representation in parliament, making it expedient for him to call a snap poll while his popularity remains high.

Headline: Russia, Ukraine swap prisoners in landmark 'first step' to ease tensions
Description: Russia and Ukraine conducted a major prisoner exchange that freed 35 people detained in each country and flew them to the other, a deal that could help advance Russia-Ukraine relations and end five years of fighting in Ukraine's east.

Headline: G7 leaders make joint statement on fair trade
Description: A statement issued at the conclusion of the two-day meeting of the G7 leaders in the French resort city of Biarritz, says the main issues covered included trade, Iran, Libya, Ukraine and Hong Kong.

Headline: Ukraine detains Russian tanker, Moscow warns of consequences
Description: Russia threatened "there will soon be consequences" if any Russian members of the crew of the tanker detained by Kiev were "taken hostage."

Headline: Nine killed in Ukraine hotel fire
Description: The fire in the port city of Odessa led authorities to launch a country-wide inspection of safety regulations in holiday resorts and hotels in the country.

Headline: Ukraine's Zelenskiy visits frontline positions in Luhansk region
Description: Ukraine's new President Volodymyr Zelenskiy visited military positions in the country's east, where the army has been fighting Russia-backed separatists for five years. Zelenskiy was inaugurated a week ago.

Headline: Erdogan denounces Russia's annexation of Crimea
Description: Turkish President Erdogan meets Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Kiev, voices support for Ukraine's territorial integrity.

Headline: Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752: The questions that need answers
Description: Western officials say that the flight was brought down by a missile fired by the Iranians while Tehran insists that the likely cause was a mechanical failure.

Headline: Fast and deadly: missile system suspected of bringing down Ukraine Boeing
Description: As more information emerges on the tragic Ukrainian passenger jet crash in Iran, it appears the plane may have been accidentally shot down by an Iranian anti-aircraft missile, possibly a Tor-M1.

Headline: Iran 'accidentally' shot down Ukraine airliner – US, Canadian, UK leaders
Description: Iran rules out a missile strike as the cause of a Ukrainian passenger plane crash, saying such a scenario made "no sense," as US media citing officials report the plane was mistakenly downed by Iran during confrontation with US.

Headline: Erdogan and Putin inaugurate TurkStream pipeline
Description: The Turkish and Russian presidents formally launched TurkStream gas pipeline which will carry Russian natural gas to southern Europe through Turkey. The project is part of Moscow's efforts to reduce shipments via Ukraine.

Headline: Russia's Gazprom pays $2.9B to Ukraine's Naftogaz
Description: Gazprom said Naftogaz of Ukraine has confirmed receipt of $2.918 billion in compensation from Gazprom in compliance with the 2018 Stockholm Arbitration's award.

Headline: Ukraine rivals exchange 200 prisoners in controversial swap
Description: Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in eastern regions completed the prisoner swap, exchanging all remaining detainees in the five-year conflict.

Headline: Zelenskiy's party in spotlight as Ukraine holds snap parliament election
Description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy dissolved the Verkhovna Rada during his swearing-in ceremony in May, triggering snap polls.

Headline: Ukraine president's party on course to win majority in new parliament
Description: The Servant of the People party has the largest share in votes counted as yet in the snap parliamentary election, according to the election commission.

Headline: Zelenskiy's party wins record score in Ukraine vote - exit polls
Description: Zelenskiy's Servant of the People party — named after the sitcom he starred in before his shock presidential win in April — took 43.9 percent of the vote in Sunday's election, according to combined figures from three pollsters.

Headline: Council of Europe assembly authorises Russia's return
Description: Council of Europe member states have agreed that Russia could present a delegation from Tuesday despite strong opposition from Ukraine.

Headline: Ukraine, separatists begin troop pullback
Description: Ukraine begins to withdraw troops and weapons from the contact line following OSCE disengagement agreement.

Headline: Ukraine 'won't interfere' in Trump impeachment probe - President Zelenskiy
Description: House Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff citing witnesses says that US President Donald Trump's phone call with Ukranian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy was planned in advance and then followed up.

Headline: Ukraine's descent into partisan ping pong in the US benefits Russia
Description: Impeachment proceedings in the US are obscuring US foreign policy on Ukraine, and only one victor will emerge from this scenario: Russia.

Headline: Ukraine's Zelenskyy vows to do all he can to bring back Crimea
Description: Top officials from 46 countries and blocs are taking part in a summit to discuss the issue of Russia's Crimea's annexation in 2014.

Headline: Russia's Gazprom completes Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline construction
Description: Energy giant Gazprom announces completion of controversial subsea pipeline to Germany that will allow Moscow to increase its gas exporting capability and bypass Ukraine.

Headline: Biden gives no assurance to Ukraine's Zelensky on NATO membership
Description: But the US president has assured his administration's support to Ukraine in face of Russian aggression.

Headline: EU recognises Covid certificates from Turkey, Ukraine and North Macedonia
Description: The EU already has an equivalence agreement with non-member Switzerland and has been working for some time to set up a mutually recognised system with the United States, so far with little progress.

Headline: Ukraine calls Russia's gas pipeline 'dangerous geopolitical weapon'
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel visits Kiev to meet with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, an ally she has supported in conflict with pro-Russia separatists but has also disappointed him with her appetite for Russian gas.

Headline: Ukrainian soldier killed by rebel fire amid rising tensions with Russia
Description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken warns of “consequences” if Russia acts “aggressively” towards Ukraine amid rising alarm over Russian troop build-up on the border of the former Soviet republic.

Headline: Is Russia about to launch a new offensive in Ukraine?
Description: Russia's provocations are not going unheard in the West where tangible support for Ukraine is only increasing.

Headline: Ukraine accuses Russia of 'openly' threatening destruction
Description: Ukraine's foreign minister says Moscow's actions and statements are aimed at escalating military tensions and undermining diplomatic efforts to resolve the Russian-Ukrainian conflict.

Headline: US to send warships to Black Sea as tensions rise in Ukraine's Donbass
Description: Russia's deputy foreign minister raised concerns over what he said was increasing Black Sea naval activity by powers that did not have a coastline in the region, an apparent reference to the United States.

Headline: Ukraine president visits frontline amid unease over Russian troop movement
Description: Russia has built up troops along the border, raising fears of a major escalation in the long-running conflict in Ukraine's mainly Russian-speaking east.

Headline: Ukraine seeks rapid NATO membership amid tensions with Russia
Description: Ukrainian President Zelenskiy calls on NATO member states to strengthen their military presence in the Black Sea region to act as a "powerful deterrent" to Russia. Kremlin says NATO membership for Ukraine would do no good in resolving the conflict.

Headline: Russia warns US, NATO against Ukraine troop deployment
Description: NATO and Kiev have warned Russia against building up troops near eastern Ukraine, prompting Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov to threaten Western countries with force if they send troops to join the fray.

Headline: Ukraine files EU rights case against Russia for state-sanctioned hits
Description: Kiev has accused Moscow of targeted “assassinations of perceived opponents” in Russia and other countries.

Headline: Turkey brings back two senior FETO members from Ukraine
Description: Salih Fidan and Samet Gure, who were handling the terror group's activities in Iraq, were arrested while trying to illegally cross the Ukraine-Poland border.

Headline: Trump's cynical ploys: a straight line from the Middle East to DC
Description: US President Donald Trump's leadership bears responsibility for both the recent sack of the US Congress, and the downing of Ukraine Air flight 752 exactly a year ago.
